entries.journalEntry: Today I learned that a function that is not named is called an anonymous function, which is also sometimes referred to as a lambda function.
Today I learned that you do not need parantheses around a parameter in an arrow function if there is only parameter in the function.
Today I learned that readable code is preferrable to clever code, even if it takes longer to write out and is less efficient.
Today I learned about the acronym DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself), which means you should avoid repeating lines of codes.
Today I learned about factory functions, which are functions that start with the word create and are generally used to create something.
Today I learned about the four most common commands in Postman (a program for working with JSON server data): GET, POST, DELETE, and PUT.
Today I learned an important tip, which is using the debugger at each step of the data fetching process to make sure the data is being returned correctly.
Today I learned the difference between internal code, which is code that exists within a function, and external code, which is code outside the function that invokes the internal code.
